featured.text: Jack: No, we rented some at the nearby village.

After the 1960s, and especially since the 1980s, the high school prom in many areas has become a serious exercise in excessive consumption, with boys renting expensive tuxedos and girls wearing designer gowns.
After spending most of her salary on rent and food, Amelia _____ had any money left for entertainment and other expenses.
The name of this hotel is the Capsule Inn; its rooms rent for eleven dollars a night.
I like everything about the apartment the rent.

definition.zh_def: 租金；租用某物的行為或過程。
definition.en_def: The payment made periodically by a tenant to a landlord for the use of land or property.
definition.example: I need to pay my rent by the end of the month.
